other_tests.findings: One woman underwent unilateral autologous/implant reconstruction followed by bariatric surgery and subsequently required revision.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In one case, significant bra roll and double-bubble deformity developed after weight loss; in another case, complications related to weight loss required revision after reconstruction.

other_tests.findings: Patient experienced substantial abdominal skin laxity and breast deflation with ptosis after reconstruction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The reconstructions became progressively more flat and required a second revision of the excess mastectomy flap skin and repositioning of breast flaps 7 months later.

other_tests.findings: BMI decreased from 35 to 30 after surgery.
Patient history indicated high-grade invasive ductal carcinoma replaced by bilateral mastectomy.
